But a world where nothing is right or wrong - where everyone could simply do as they wished without regard to anybody else's needs or wishes - would be chaotic. It would make civilisation impossible. It wouldn't work. So moral codes come into existence. They are a necessity.
     
In order for civilisation to be possible, attitudes and activities need to be labelled as 'right', 'good', 'correct', etc; and their corresponding opposites need to be labelled as 'wrong', 'bad', 'incorrect', etc. So ideas of morality come into being, to give effect to this process.
